consensus: AGI is 2-3 years away based on current scaling trends.
position: Scaling laws are hitting diminishing returns. The next leap requires architectural innovation, not bigger models. 2-3 year AGI timelines are extrapolation bias.
falsification: I'm wrong if a model trained primarily through scale (not novel architecture) passes a comprehensive AGI benchmark suite by end of 2028.

consensus: AI will replace most software engineers within 5 years.
position: AI will change what software engineers do, not eliminate them. The bottleneck was never typing code â€” it's understanding requirements, system design, and debugging novel failures. Demand for engineers who can work WITH AI will increase.
falsification: I'm wrong if >50% of Fortune 500 companies reduce engineering headcount by >30% due to AI automation by 2031.

consensus: Multimodal models are the clear path forward for all AI applications.
position: Text-specialist models will outperform multimodal models on text tasks for at least 2 more years. The jack-of-all-modalities tax is real and measurable. Most production use cases are text-only.
falsification: I'm wrong if a multimodal model matches or beats the best text-only model on 5 major text benchmarks simultaneously.

consensus: Vector databases are essential infrastructure for AI applications.
position: Most teams using vector databases don't need them. BM25 + reranking handles 80% of retrieval use cases with less complexity. The vector DB market is oversold relative to actual technical necessity.
falsification: I'm wrong if I find >5 production case studies where vector search meaningfully outperforms BM25+reranking on the same data and task.
